title: The River of Life and Land Inheritance
shortSummary: Ezekiel 47 describes a visionary river flowing from the temple, bringing life and healing wherever it goes, symbolizing God's restoration and blessing. The chapter concludes with detailed instructions for the division of the Promised Land among the twelve tribes of Israel, emphasizing God's faithfulness to His covenant promises.
timeline: c. 593-571 BC - During the Babylonian exile, prophetic visions of restoration

keyCharacters.name: Ezekiel
keyCharacters.description: The prophet receiving the vision of the life-giving river and the future division of the land.

keyCharacters.name: The Man with the Line
keyCharacters.description: A figure guiding Ezekiel through the vision, measuring the depth of the river and explaining its significance.

definitions.definition: An ancient unit of length, approximately 18 inches, used here to measure the depth and distance of the river.
The bottom part of a doorway; here it symbolizes the point from which the life-giving waters flow out of the temple.
The holy place or temple where God's presence dwells; the source of the river's healing waters.
The land allotted to each tribe of Israel as a possession, signifying God's covenantal promise.

outline.heading: Vision of the River Flowing from the Temple
outline.description: Ezekiel is led to see water flowing from under the temple threshold, growing deeper as it moves eastward, symbolizing increasing life and blessing from God's presence.

outline.heading: The River Brings Life and Healing
outline.description: The river flows into the desert and the sea, healing the waters and supporting abundant fish and fruit-bearing trees whose leaves provide medicine, illustrating God's restorative power.

outline.heading: The Boundaries of the Land Inheritance
outline.description: God outlines the borders of the land to be inherited by the twelve tribes of Israel, reaffirming His promise to restore and bless His people with a permanent homeland.

outline.heading: Division of the Land Among Israelites and Strangers
outline.description: Instructions are given for dividing the land by lot among the tribes, including provisions for strangers who live among Israel, emphasizing inclusion within God's covenant community.

application: Trust in God's power to bring spiritual life and restoration, even in barren or difficult circumstances.
Recognize that true healing and blessing flow from God's presence, encouraging regular fellowship with Him through prayer and worship.
Honor God's promises by living obediently and faithfully, knowing He is faithful to fulfill His covenant.
Embrace the call to include others in God's family, showing hospitality and generosity to those who join the community of faith.

keyVerses.text: And it shall come to pass, that every thing that liveth, which moveth, whithersoever the rivers shall come, shall live: and there shall be a very great multitude of fish, because these waters shall come thither: for they shall be healed; and every thing shall live whither the river cometh.
keyVerses.significance: This verse highlights the life-giving and healing power of God's presence, symbolized by the river that sustains all living things.

keyVerses.text: And by the river upon the bank thereof, on this side and on that side, shall grow all trees for meat, whose leaf shall not fade, neither shall the fruit thereof be consumed: it shall bring forth new fruit according to his months, because their waters they issued out of the sanctuary: and the fruit thereof shall be for meat, and the leaf thereof for medicine.
keyVerses.significance: This verse emphasizes the continual provision and healing that come from God's sanctuary, symbolizing spiritual nourishment and restoration.

keyVerses.text: Thus saith the Lord GOD; This shall be the border, whereby ye shall inherit the land according to the twelve tribes of Israel: Joseph shall have two portions.
keyVerses.significance: This verse affirms God's covenant promise to Israel regarding the inheritance of the land, underscoring His faithfulness.
